monster.name: Otherworldly Familiar

hp.special: 2 + 2 per spell level (the familiar has a number of Hit Dice [d4s] equal to the spell's level)

languages: Telepathy 120ft. (only between you and the familiar),

trait.name: Amphibious (Water Only)
entries: The familiar can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Extradimensional Escape (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the familiar would drop to 0 Hit Points, it instead drops to 1 Hit Point and vanishes into an extradimensional space, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying. It remains there for 1 hour or until you summon it as a Magic action, and then it reappears in your space.

action.name: Otherworldly Scratch
entries: {@atk ms} your Spell Attack Modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 + the spell's level of Radiant damage (Celestial), Psychic damage (Fey), or Necrotic damage (Fiend).

reaction.name: Deliver Spell
entries: When you cast a spell with a range of touch, the familiar can deliver the spell with its touch. To do so, the familiar must be within 120 feet of you.

monster.name: Otherworldly Steed

hp.special: 5 + 10 per spell level (the steed has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to the spell's level)

languages: Telepathy 1 mile (only between you and the steed)

action.name: Otherworldly Maul
entries: {@atk ms} your Spell Attack Modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@dice 1d8} + the spell's level of Radiant damage (Celestial), Psychic damage (Fey), or Necrotic damage (Fiend).

bonus.name: Idyllic Step (Idyllic Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The steed teleports, along with its rider, to an unoccupied space of your choice up to 60 feet away.

bonus.name: Biblical Glare (Biblical Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Numerous eyes open as it targets one creature it can perceive up to 60 feet away. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC or have the Frightened condition until the end of your next turn.

bonus.name: Exalted Touch (Exalted Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The steed touches another creature and restores a number of Hit Points to it equal to {@dice 2d8} + the spell's level.

trait.name: Life Bond
entries: When you regain Hit Points from a spell of 1st level or higher, the steed regains the same number of Hit Points if you're within 5 feet of it.

spell.name: True Strike

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 10 feet would fail an attack roll

entries: Add a {@dice d4}, potentially turning it into a success. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can cast this once and regain all uses after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of uses increases by 1 at 5th level (2 uses), 11th level (3 uses), and 17th level (4 uses).

spell.name: Guidance

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 10 feet would fail an ability check

entries: Add a {@dice d4}, potentially turning it into a success. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can cast this once and regain all uses after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of uses increases by 1 at 5th level (2 uses), 11th level (3 uses), and 17th level (4 uses).

spell.name: Resistance

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 10 feet would fail a saving throw

entries: Add a {@dice d4}, potentially turning it into a success. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can cast this once and regain all uses after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of uses increases by 1 at 5th level (2 uses), 11th level (3 uses), and 17th level (4 uses).

spell.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher Warlock levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

spell.name: Vicious Mockery
entries: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature you can see or hear within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage and have Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes that does not already have disadvantage before the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach certain Bard levels: 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Acid Splash
entries: You create an acidic bubble and hurl it at a point within range, where it explodes in a 5- foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that sphere must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Acid damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Blade Ward

time.condition: which you take in response to a visible creature targeting you with a melee attack

entries: You trace a sigil of warding, imposing Disadvantage on the creature's attack roll against you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell gives Disadvantage to a subsequent melee attack roll made against you by the triggering creature before the start of their next turn at levels 5 (1 subsequent attack), 11 (2 subsequent attacks), and 17 (3 subsequent attacks).

spell.name: Chill Touch
entries: You channel the chill of the grave toward one creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage, and it can't regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Friends
entries: You magically emanate a sense of friendship toward one visible creature within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration. The target succeeds automatically if it isn't a Humanoid, if you're fighting it, or if you have cast this spell on it within the past 24 hours. The spell ends early if an ally does something harmful to them.

components.m: some makeup

spell.name: Poison Spray
entries: You launch a mist of toxic energy at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} Poison damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d12}), 11 ({@dice 3d12}), and 17 ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Produce Flame
entries: A flickering flame appears in your hand and remains there for the duration. While there, the flame emits no heat and ignites nothing, and it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as a Bonus Action or if you cast it again. Until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to hurl fire at a creature or an object within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Shillelagh
entries: A Club, Greatclub, Staff or Quarterstaff you are holding is imbued with nature's power. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon's damage die becomes a {@dice d8}. If the attack deals damage, it can be Force damage or the weapon's normal damage type (your choice). The spell ends early if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.

components.m: mistletoe, a shamrock leaf, and a Club or Quarterstaff

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The weapon's damage die changes when you reach levels 5 ({@dice d10}), 11({@dice d12}), and 17 ({@dice 2d6}).

spell.name: Magic Stone
entries: You touch one to three pebbles and imbue them with magic. You or someone else can make a ranged spell attack with one of the pebbles by throwing it or hurling it with a sling, slingshot or warsling. If thrown, it has a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with the pebble, that attacker adds your spellcasting ability modifier, not the attacker's, to the attack roll. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Hit or miss, the spell then ends on the stone. If you cast this spell again, the spell ends early on any pebbles still affected by it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The attack's damage die changes when you reach levels 5 ({@dice d8}), 11({@dice d10}), and 17 ({@dice d12}).

spell.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Lightning damage, and expends a reaction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Spare the Dying
entries: You take the Stabilize action on a creature in range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's range increases by 30 when you reach levels 5 (60 feet), 11 (90 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

spell.name: Control Flames
entries: You choose nonmagical flame that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You affect it in one of the following ways:
- You instantaneously create a new flame that fits within a 5-foot cube within 5 ft of it. Until the end of your next turn the new flame persists without fuel.
- You instantaneously extinguish the flames within the cube.
- You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the flame, change its color, or both. The change lasts for 1 hour.
- You cause simple shapes—such as the vague form of a creature, an inanimate object, or a location—to appear within the flames and animate as you like. The shapes last for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Mold Earth
entries: You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it and move it 5 feet. This movement doesn't have enough force to cause damage. Until the end of your next turn it is held aloft as long as it is not holding anything else aloft.
You sculpt a simple shape into a chunk of earth that weighs no more than 5 pounds.
You cause it to become difficult terrain. If it is already difficult terrain, it becomes normal terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Shape Water
entries: You choose an area of water that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

- You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn't have enough force to cause damage. Until the end of your next turn it is held aloft as long as it is not holding anything else aloft.
- You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour.
- You change the water's color or opacity. The water must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour.
- You freeze the water for 1 hour, provided that there are no creatures in it.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Gust
entries: You seize the air and compel it to create one of the following effects at a point you can see within range:
- One Medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from you.

- You create a small blast of air capable of moving one object that is neither held nor carried and that weighs no more than 5 pounds. The object is pushed up to 15 feet away from you. It isn't pushed with enough force to cause damage. Until the end of your next turn it is held aloft as long as it is not holding anything else aloft.
- You create a harmless sensory effect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters shut, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Shield

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature you can touch be hit by an attack or targeted by the Magic Missiles spell

entries: A spectral shield appears and protects the creature you touched for one minute. They can gain 2 AC against one attack of their choice that would hit them. They can choose to instead gain immunity to 4 magic missiles (from the Magic Missiles spell) of their choice that target them. Do not apply the bonus to your AC if a positive bonus is already being applied to your AC by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of attacks or magic missiles they can choose increases by one for each slot level above 1.

spell.name: Absorb Elements

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

entries: Subtract a {@dice d6} from the damage of the triggering damage type that the creature took. Once before the end of their next turn when they hit with a melee attack they may deal additional damage of the same amount and type prevented.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount subtracted increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Hellish Rebuke

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch is damaged by a creature you can see within 60ft

entries: You point your finger, and the creature that damaged them is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Feather Fall

time.condition: which you take when a creature within 60ft falls

entries: The falling creature makes a dexterity saving throw. They can choose to fail this saving throw. If they fail, their rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the spell ends for that creature.

components.m: a small feather or piece of down

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can target an additional creature for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Gift of Gab

time.condition: which you take when a creature within 90ft hears you speak

entries: You attempt to skillfully reshape the memories of a listener. They make an Intelligence Saving Throw. If they fail, they forget everything you said within the last 6 seconds, including the verbal components of spells, and remember that you actually said the words you speak as the verbal component of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can target one additional creature per additional spell level.

spell.name: Soul Cage

time.condition: which you take when a humanoid you can see within 60ft of you dies

entries: This spell snatches the soul of a humanoid as it dies and traps it inside the tiny cage you use for the material component. A stolen soul remains inside the cage until the spell ends or until you destroy the cage, which ends the spell. While you have a soul inside the cage, you can exploit it in any of the ways described below. You can use a trapped soul up to six times. Once you exploit a soul for the sixth time, it is released, and the spell ends. While a soul is trapped, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.
Steal Life. You can use a bonus action to drain vigor from the soul and regain {@dice 2d8} hit points.

Query Soul. You ask the soul a question (no action required) and receive a brief telepathic answer, which you can understand regardless of the language used. The soul knows only what it knew in life, but it must answer you truthfully and to the best of its ability. The answer is no more than a sentence or two and might be cryptic.

Borrow Experience. You can use a bonus action to bolster yourself with the soul's life experience, making your next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage. If you don't use this benefit before the start of your next turn, it is lost.

Eyes of the Dead. You can use an action to name a place the humanoid saw in life, which creates an {@condition invisible} sensor somewhere in that place if it is on the plane of existence you're currently on. The sensor remains for as long as you concentrate, up to 10 minutes (as if you were {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). You receive visual and auditory information from the sensor as if you were in its space using your senses.
A creature that can see the sensor (such as one using see invisibility or truesight) sees a translucent image of the tormented humanoid whose soul you caged.

m.text: a tiny silver cage worth 100 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level you can exploit the soul an additional 2 times for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Counterspell

time.condition: which you take when a creature you see within 60ft casts a spell with Verbal, Somatic or Material components

entries: You attempt to interrupt the casting of a spell. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. Add the level your casting this spell at and subtract the level of the spell you're countering from your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If something such as a spell slot was expended to cast the spell, it is not expended.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description above)

spell.name: Temporal Shunt

time.condition: which you take when a creature you see within 30ft is about to make an attack roll or cast a spell

entries: You target yourself and the triggering creature. Each target must succeed on a wisdom saving throw or be thrown to the same random point in time. If the triggering creature failed, the attack or spell they were about to make is canceled before it's used. At the start of the triggering creature's next turn, each target returns to the present in the nearest unoccupied space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target an additional creature of your choice that you can see within 30ft for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Hunter's Mark
entries: You choose one creature you can see within range and magically mark it as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage to the target the first time you hit it with an attack roll on any turn. You choose the damage type when you prepare the spell. You also have Advantage on any Wisdom (Perception or Survival) check you make to find it. If the target drops to 0 or less Hit Points before this spell ends, you can use a Bonus Action to mark a new creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours, and the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d6}. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours, and the extra damage increases to {@dice 3d6}.

spell.name: Conjure Barrage
entries: You brandish the weapon used to cast the spell and conjure similar spectral weapons (or ammunition appropriate to the weapon) that shoot forward and then disappear. Each creature of your choice that you can see in a 60-foot cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} Force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

components.m: melee or ranged weapon worth at least 1 CP

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Volley
entries: You brandish the weapon used to cast the spell and choose a point within range. Hundreds of similar spectral weapons (or ammunition appropriate to the weapon) fall in a volley from above and then disappear. Each creature of your choice that you can see in a 40-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d8} Force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

components.m: a melee or ranged weapon worth at least 1 CP

spell.name: Banishing Smite
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action immediately after hitting a creature with a melee weapon attack. As you hit the creature, your strike erupts with divine power. The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 5d10} Force damage from the attack. If the attack reduces the target to 50 Hit Points or fewer, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration.
While in the demiplane, the target has the Incapacitated condition. When the spell ends on the target, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

spell.name: Blinding Smite
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon attack. As you hit the target, your strike flares with light. The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 3d8} Radiant damage from the attack, and the target has the Blinded condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the Blinded target repeats the saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Searing Smite
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action immediately after hitting a creature with a melee weapon attack. As you hit the target, your strike flares with white-hot intensity, and the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage from the attack and ignites with magical fire. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Fire damage and then must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell continues. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, any damage dealt by the spell increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Staggering Smite
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon attack. As you hit the creature, your strike pierces both body and mind. The target takes an extra {@damage 4d6} Psychic damage from the attack, and the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Stunned condition until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6}.

spell.name: Thunderous Smite
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon attack. As you hit the target, your strike rings with thunder that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Thunder damage from the attack. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and have the Prone condition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wrathful Smite
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon attack. As you hit the creature, your strike channels divine wrath. The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage from the attack, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the Frightened target repeats the saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Find Familiar

m.text: 10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier

entries: You gain the service of an otherworldly spirit, which manifests as a little animal in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Familiar | GaldeveerTanksandFlanks} stat block. If you already have a familiar from this spell, your familiar is replaced by the new one.

Whenever you prepare the spell, choose the familiar's creature type: Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. You can prepare this spell multiple times to select multiple creature types. Whenever you cast the spell, choose the familiar's environment: Air, Land, or Water. The familiar resembles a Tiny animal of your choice—such as an owl, a cat, or a frog—that is native to the chosen environment. Both choices—creature type and environment—determine certain traits in the stat block.
Ally. The familiar is an ally to you and your allies. See NPCs.

Disappearance of the Familiar. The familiar disappears if it drops to 0 Hit Points, if you dismiss it as a Bonus Action, or if you die. When it disappears, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying.
Remote Viewing. As a Magic action, you can see what your familiar sees and hear what it hears until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 2nd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Find Steed

m.text: 10 GP worth of charcoal, incense, and holy texts that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier

entries: You gain the service of an otherworldly being, which manifests as a large steed in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Steed | GaldeveerTanksandFlanks} stat block. If you already have a steed from this spell, your steed is replaced by the new one.

Whenever you prepare the spell, choose the steed's creature type: Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. You can prepare this spell multiple times to select multiple creature types. Whenever you cast the spell, choose the steed's archetype: Idyllic, Biblical, or Exalted. The steed resembles a Large, rideable animal of your choice—such as a horse, a camel, a dire wolf, or an elk—that symbolizes the chosen archetype. The steed is an ally to you and your allies. See NPCs.

Disappearance of the Steed. The steed disappears if it drops to 0 Hit Points, if you dismiss it as a Bonus Action, or if you die. When it disappears, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 3rd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Misty Step
entries: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher spell levels, increase the distance you teleport by 10 ft for each additional level.

spell.name: Conjure Animals
entries: You summon nature spirits that take the form of a Large swarm of spectral animals in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The swarm lasts for the duration, and you choose the animal form of the spirits, such as wolves, serpents, or birds.

When a creature hostile to you enters a space within 10 feet of the swarm for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, you can make a melee spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes Radiant damage equal to {@dice 2d10} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. You have Advantage on Strength saving throws while you're within 10 feet of the swarm, and when you Move on your turn, you can also move the swarm up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 4 or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3.

spell.name: Conjure Celestial
entries: You summon the protective presence of a Celestial spirit, which manifests as a pillar of divine light that shines in a 10-foot-radius, 40- foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Bright Light fills the Cylinder, and when you Move on your turn, you can also move the Cylinder up to 30 feet. When a creature enters the Cylinder for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, you can bathe that creature in one of the following lights:

Healing Light. The creature that isn't an Undead or a Construct regains Hit Points equal to {@dice 4d12} plus your spellcasting modifier. A creature can be healed by this light only once per casting of this spell.

Searing Radiance. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 8d12} Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature can be damaged by this light only once per casting of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 8 or higher, the healing and damage increase by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 7.

spell.name: Conjure Elemental
entries: You summon an Elemental spirit that fills a 10- foot Cube within range. The spirit lasts for the duration and is composed of air, earth, fire, or water (your choice) when you cast this spell. When a creature hostile to you Moves within 5 feet of the spirit, you can make a melee spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} damage of a type determined by the spirit's element: Bludgeoning (earth), Cold (water), Fire (fire), or Lightning (air). If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is also pulled into the Cube and has the Restrained condition. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a success, the target frees itself. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 4d8} damage of the same type as the spell attack. The spirit can have only one creature {@condition restrained} at a time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 6 or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 5.

spell.name: Conjure Fey
entries: You summon the awesome presence of a Medium Fey spirit in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The spirit lasts for the duration, and it looks like a Fey creature of your choice. When the spirit appears, you can immediately make one melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the spirit. On a hit, the target takes Psychic damage equal to {@dice 3d12} plus your spellcasting ability modifier, and the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition until the start of your next turn.
As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can teleport the spirit to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of the space it left and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 7 or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d12} for each slot level above 6.

spell.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
entries: You summon elemental spirits that flit around you for the duration. Until the spell ends, any attack you make deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage when you hit a creature within 15 feet of you. This damage is Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning (your choice when you make the attack). In addition, the ground within 15 feet of you is Difficult Terrain for your enemies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 5 or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} and the range of Difficult Terrain increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4.

spell.name: Conjure Woodland Beings
entries: You summon nature spirits that flit about you for the duration. Until the spell ends, each creature you choose that enters a space within 10 feet of you for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, you can take the Disengage action as a Bonus Action for the spell's duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 6 or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5.

spell.name: Prayer of Healing
entries: You utter an extended prayer of restoration. Choose a number of willing creatures equal to your Spellcasting Ability Modifier (minimum of 1). Each of those creatures who remains within range for the Spell's entire casting gains the benefits of a Short Rest and also regains {@dice 2d8} Hit Points, and a creature can't be affected by this Spell again until that creature finishes a Long Rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this Spell using a Spell Slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Spiritual Weapon
entries: You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and that lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force Damage equal to {@damage 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|2,4,6,8|1d8} for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Aid

components.m: a tiny strip of white cloth

entries: Your spell bolsters creatures, filling them with resolve. Choose up to six creatures within range. Each target gains 5 Temporary Hit Points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number of Temporary Hit Points increases by 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Jump

components.m: a grasshopper's hind leg

entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the start of your next turn, their jump distance increases by 10 ft. Additionally, once within the duration they can move up to 10 ft during a jump without spending movement.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 2 or higher, their jump distance and the distance they can move without spending movement increases by 10ft for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Power Word Kill
entries: You utter a word of power that can compel one creature you can see within range to die instantly. If the creature you choose has 100 Hit Points or fewer, it dies. Otherwise, the target takes {@damage 12d12} Psychic damage.

spell.name: Banishment

components.m: an item distasteful to the target

entries: You attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Charisma Saving Throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration. The target can willingly fail the save.

While in the demiplane, the target is Incapacitated. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the save, ending the Spell on itself on a success. When the Spell ends on the target, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the Spell lasts on the target for 1 minute and the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn't return. It is instead transported to a random location on a plane associated with its Creature Type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this Spell using a Spell Slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Barkskin

components.m: a handful of oak bark

entries: You touch one willing creature to protect it with regenerating bark. Until the Spell ends, the target's skin assumes a bark-like appearance, and at the start of each of the target's turns, the target gains a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier plus your proficiency bonus.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this Spell using a Spell Slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional willing creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cure Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on Constructs and Undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 2 or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 2d8|1-9|2d8} for each slot level above 1.

spell.name: Healing Word
entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 2d4|1-9|2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mass Cure Wounds
entries: A wave of healing energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to {@dice 5d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 3d8|5-9|1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Mass Healing Word
entries: As you call out words of restoration, up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 1d4|3-9|1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Bane

components.m: a drop of blood

entries: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw. Do not add it if a negative bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Speak with Animals
entries: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM's discretion.

spell.name: Detect Magic
entries: For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic of spell level 1 or lower in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears that magic, and you learn its {@book school of magic|PHB|10|The Schools of Magic}, if any.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this at higher levels, the level of spell you can use an action to detect increases by 1 for each additional level.

spell.name: Polymorph

components.m: a caterpillar cocoon

entries: This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form and grants temporary hit points. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. A shapechanger automatically succeeds on this saving throw. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the save, ending the Spell on itself on a success. When the spell ends, remove the creature's temporary hit points if they are equal to or less than the amount granted to them by this spell.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target no longer has temporary hit points. When you prepare this spell, pick three beast stat blocks from the same source book. You can prepare this spell multiple times to pick more stat blocks. The form you turn the target into must have a challenge rating less than or equal to twice the level this spell is being casted at. The target's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its hit points, saving throw modifiers, alignment and personality. The target gains temporary hit points equal to the CR of the stat block plus the stat blocks constitution modifier.
The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. This spell can't affect a target that has 0 hit points

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description above).

spell.name: True Polymorph

components.m: a drop of mercury, a dollop of gum arabic, and a wisp of smoke

entries: Choose one creature or nonmagical object that you can see within range. You transform the creature into a different creature, the creature into a nonmagical object, or the nonmagical object into a creature (the object must be neither worn nor carried by another creature). The transformation lasts for the duration. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the transformation becomes permanent. When you prepare this spell, pick 3 stat blocks of CR 18 or less from the same source book. You can prepare this spell multiple times to pick more stat blocks.

Shapechangers aren't affected by this spell. An unwilling creature can make a Wisdom saving throw, and if it succeeds, it isn't affected by this spell. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the save, ending the Spell on itself on a success.
This spell can't affect a target that has 0 hit points.

entries.name: Creature into Creature
entries: If you turn a creature into another kind of creature, the new form is one of the stat blocks you prepared with this spell. The target's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the new form. It retains its hit points, saving throw modifiers, alignment and personality. While transformed the creature cannot cast spells or change shape. The target gains temporary hit points equal to the stat blocks CR plus the stat block's constitution modifier. If they run out of temporary hit points before the spell becomes permanent, the spell ends. When the spell ends, remove their temporary hit points if they are equal to or less than the amount granted to them by this spell.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech unless its new form is capable of such actions.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

entries.name: Object into Creature
entries: You can turn an object into one of the stat blocks you prepared with this spell, as long as the creature's size is no larger than the object's size and the creature's challenge rating is 9 or lower. The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It acts on each of your turns. You decide what action it takes and how it moves. The DM has the creature's statistics and resolves all of its actions and movement.
If the spell becomes permanent, you no longer control the creature. It might remain friendly to you, depending on how you have treated it.

entries.name: Creature into Object
entries: If you turn a creature into an object, it transforms along with whatever it is wearing and carrying into that form, as long as the object's size is no larger than the creature's size. The creature's statistics become those of the object, and the creature has no memory of time spent in this form, after the spell ends and it returns to its normal form.

spell.name: Ensnaring Strike
entries: You cast this spell as a bonus action after you hit with an attack roll. A writhing mass of thorny vines grows from the wound, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the magical vines until the spell ends. A Large or larger creature has advantage on this saving throw and a small or smaller creature has disadvantage. If the target succeeds on the save, the vines shrivel away.
While {@condition restrained} by this spell, at the start of each of its turns the target takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage then can reroll the saving throw. On a success, they are freed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Hail of Thorns
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action when you hit with a weapon. The target of the attack and each creature within 5 feet of it other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 1d10} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d10|1-6|1d10} for each slot level above 1st (to a maximum of {@dice 6d10}).

spell.name: Zephyr Strike
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action before making an attack roll with a weapon. Give the attack roll advantage. Immediately after the attack hits you can move up to 10 ft in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the distance you move by 10 ft for each additional level (up to a maximum of 60 ft).

spell.name: Healing Spirit
entries: You call forth a nature spirit to soothe the wounded. The intangible spirit appears in a space that is a 5-foot cube you can see within range. The spirit looks like a transparent beast or fey (your choice).

Until the spell ends, whenever you or a creature you can see moves into the spirit's space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, you can cause the spirit to restore 3 temporary hit points to that creature (no action required). The spirit can't heal constructs or undead.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the Spirit up to 30 feet to a space you can see. The spirit can heal a number of times equal to 1 + your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of twice). After healing that number of times, the spirit disappears.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 2 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Vortex Warp
entries: You magically twist space around another creature you can see within range that is large or smaller. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (they can choose to fail), or the target is teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The chosen space must be on a surface or in a liquid that can support the target without the target having to squeeze.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range of the spell increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Pass without Trace

components.m: ashes from a burned leaf of mistletoe and a sprig of spruce

entries: A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, creatures of your choice within 30 ft of you add a {@dice d8} when they make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check and can't be tracked except by magical means. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, each creature can reroll a {@dice d8} granted to them by this spell once for each additional level. They must use the new roll.

spell.name: Spirit Guardians

components.m: a holy symbol

entries: You call forth a 15 ft radius of spirits to protect you. Creatures of your choice treat the area as difficult terrain. Additionally, creatures within the affected area must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 2d6} radiant or necrotic damage. Choose the damage type when you prepare the spell. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. When a creature makes the saving throw they don't need to do so again until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fireball

components.m: a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Evard's Black Tentacles

components.m: a piece of tentacle from a giant octopus or a giant squid

entries: Squirming, ebony tentacles fill a 20-foot square on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, flat surfaces in the area are {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

Creatures in the affected area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and be {@condition restrained} by the tentacles until the start of their next turn. When a creature makes the saving throw they don't need to do so again until the start of their next turn. If the creature leaves the area, they are no longer {@condition restrained}. The creature can use their action to make the saving throw again. On a success they are no longer {@condition restrained}.

spell.name: Web

components.m: a bit of spiderweb

entries: You conjure a mass of thick, sticky webbing at a point of your choice within range. The webs fill a 20-foot cube for the duration. The webs are difficult terrain and lightly obscure their area.

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the conjured web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn.

Creatures in the affected area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the webs until the start of their next turn. When a creature makes the saving throw they don't need to do so again until the start of their next turn. If the creature leaves the area, they are no longer {@condition restrained}. The creature can use their action to make the saving throw again. On a success they are no longer {@condition restrained}.

If the webs are exposed to fire they all burn. Any creature that is {@condition restrained} by the webs while they are burning takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage. Once they take this damage they cannot take it again until the start of their next turn. After 1 round of burning, all the webs are burned away and the spell ends.

spell.name: Entangle
entries: Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

Creatures in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the entangling plants until the spell ends. At the start of its turn the creature can repeat the saving throw, breaking free on a success. If the creature leaves the area, they are no longer {@condition restrained}. The creature can use their action to make the saving throw again. On a success they are no longer {@condition restrained}.
When the spell ends, the conjured plants wilt away.

spell.name: Dispel Magic
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability and add the level you're casting this spell at. The DC is 10 plus the twice opposing spell's level or 3 times the number of digits in the item's gold cost. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (See description above)

spell.name: Tasha's Mind Whip
entries: You psychically lash out at one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage, and becomes Dazed until the start of their next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The additional targets do not need to be in range. Instead, pick each additional target one at a time. Each time you choose a target it must be within 10 ft of the original target or a previously chosen target.

spell.name: Crown of Madness
entries: One humanoid of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, a twisted crown of jagged iron appears on its head, and a madness glows in its eyes.

The {@condition charmed} target must use its action before moving on each of its turns to make a melee attack against a creature you mentally choose. The target can act normally on its turn if you choose no creature.

On your subsequent turns, you must use your action to maintain control over the target, or the spell ends. Also, the target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Revivify

m.text: diamonds worth 300 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. Their soul must be free and willing. They return to life with one less death save fail or level of {@condition exhaustion}. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts. For the next 2 minutes spells casted at levels less than or equal to the level this spell was casted at cannot bring this creature back to life.

spell.name: Raise Dead

m.text: a diamond worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has died within the last ten days and is not undead. Their soul must be free and willing. They return to life with two less death save fails or levels of {@condition exhaustion}. If they have the {@condition poisoned} condition, remove it. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts. For the next 20 days spells casted at levels less than or equal to the level this spell was casted at cannot bring this creature back to life.

spell.name: Resurrection

m.text: a diamond worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has died within the last century and is not undead. Their soul must be free and willing. They return to life with one three less death save fails or levels of {@condition exhaustion}. Any missing body parts are restored. If they have the {@condition poisoned} condition, remove it. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age. For the next 2 centuries spells casted at levels less than or equal to the level this spell was casted at cannot bring this creature back to life.

Casting this spell to restore life to a creature that has been dead for one year or longer taxes you greatly. Until you finish a long rest, you can't cast spells again, and you have disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

spell.name: Identify

m.text: a pearl worth at least 100 gp and an owl feather

entries: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, if it is cursed, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

spell.name: Goodberry

components.m: a sprig of mistletoe

entries: Up to ten berries appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A creature can use its action to eat one berry. Eating a berry restores 1 hit point. Berries that are not consumed within 24 hours no longer provide healing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, it creates five additional berries for each additional slot level.

spell.name: Ceremony

m.text: 25 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes

entries: Choose one of the following ceremonies. Decorations for that type of ceremony worth a total of 50 gp appear in locations of your choice within 15 ft of where you began casting this spell. After 24 hours the decorations disappear. Anyone who closely inspects the decorations can see that they are fake. Once within the duration while you and your targets are in the affected area you can use your action to perform the effect for this type of ceremony (listed below).

entries.name: Atonement
entries: You touch one willing creature whose alignment has changed, and you make a DC 20 Wisdom (Insight) check. On a successful check, you restore the target to its original alignment.

entries.name: Bless Water
entries: You touch one vial of water and cause it to become holy water.

entries.name: Coming of Age
entries: You touch one humanoid who is a young adult. For the next 24 hours, they cannot be aged (magically or otherwise). A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Dedication
entries: You touch one humanoid who wishes to be dedicated to your diety's service. Once within the next 24 hours when you cast a spell with a range of touch the creature can use their reaction to deliver the spell with their touch instead of yours if they are within 90 ft of you. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Funeral Rite
entries: You touch one corpse, and for the next 7 days, the target can't become undead by any means short of a Wish spell.

entries.name: Wedding
entries: You touch willing adult humanoids. Each target can sense what other alive adult humanoids the other targets have married previously in this way. If the targets are still willing, they are bonded in marriage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of second level or higher, the radius of the spell increases by 15 ft and the perceived price of the decorations is tripled for every spell slot above 1st.

spell.name: Sleep

components.m: a pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket

entries: A creature you can see within 90 ft must succeed on a constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for the duration. At the end of each of their turns they can repeat the saving throw, waking up on a success.The sleeping creature wakes up if they take damage or someone uses an action to shake or slap them awake. Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, target an additional creature for each additional slot level.

spell.name: Heat Metal

components.m: a piece of iron and a flame

entries: Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage. The creature can drop the object to avoid taking the damage if they can.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|2-9|1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Spike Growth

components.m: seven sharp thorns or seven small twigs, each sharpened to a point

entries: The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels. If a creature has taken {@damage 3d6} damage from this spell since the start of its last turn, it cannot be damaged by this spell again until the start of its next turn.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area at the time the spell is cast must make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

spell.name: Fear

components.m: a white feather or the heart of a hen

entries: You project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become {@condition frightened} for the duration.

While {@condition frightened} by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. At the end of each of the creature's turns it can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

spell.name: Hypnotic Pattern

components.m: a glowing stick of incense or a crystal vial filled with phosphorescent material

entries: You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} for the duration. While {@condition charmed} by this spell, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw to end the effect on themself. The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

spell.name: Daylight
entries: A 60-foot-radius sphere of daylight spreads out from a point you choose within range. The sphere is bright daylight and sheds dim daylight for an additional 60 feet.

If you chose a point on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the daylight shines from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the affected object with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the daylight.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell casted at a level equal to or less than the level you are casting this spell at, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description above).

spell.name: Wish
entries: Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal creature can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter the very foundations of reality in accord with your desires.

Cast another spell of 8th level or lower without expending a spell slot or its casting time. You do not need to know the spell or have it prepared. This spell's casting time is the casting time of the spell you pick. You don't need to meet any requirements in that spell, including costly components.

Instead of casting another spell you can make a boundless wish. State your wish to the DM as precisely as possible. They decide the spell's casting time based on the wish. They have great latitude in ruling what occurs in such an instance; the greater the wish, the greater the likelihood that something goes wrong. This spell might simply fail, the effect you desire might only be partly achieved, or you might suffer some unforeseen consequence as a result of how you worded the wish. For example, wishing that a villain were dead might propel you forward in time to a period when that villain is no longer alive, effectively removing you from the game. Similarly, wishing for a legendary magic item or artifact might instantly transport you to the presence of the item's current owner.

The stress of making a boundless wish instead of casting another spell weakens you. Each time you cast a spell until you finish a long rest, you take {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength drops to 3, if it isn't 3 or lower already, until you complete {@dice 2d4} long rests. Finally, there is a 33 percent chance that you are unable to cast Wish ever again.

spell.name: Feeblemind

components.m: a handful of clay, crystal, glass, or mineral spheres

entries: You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range, attempting to shatter its intellect and personality. The target takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and must make an Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them.
At the end of every 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this spell. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the spell ends.
The spell can also be ended by {@spell greater restoration}, {@spell heal}, or {@spell wish}.

spell.name: Leomund's Tiny Hut

components.m: a small crystal bead

entries: A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell ends if you leave its area.

Nine creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit inside the dome with you. The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than nine creatures. Creatures and objects within the dome when you cast this spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the dome or be cast through it. The atmosphere inside the space is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside. The dome has an AC of 5 and 60 hit points. A disintegrate spell destroys it instantly.
Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark. The dome is opaque from the outside, of any color you choose, but it is transparent from the inside.

spell.name: Wall of Force

components.m: a pinch of powder made by crushing a clear gemstone

entries: An {@condition invisible} wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick. It lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It has an AC of 5 and 120 hit points. It can't be dispelled by dispel magic. A disintegrate spell destroys it instantly. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through the wall.

spell.name: Forcecage
entries: An immobile, {@condition invisible}, cube-shaped prison composed of magical force springs into existence around an area you choose within range. The prison can be a cage or a solid box as you choose.
A prison in the shape of a cage can be up to 20 feet on a side and is made from 1/2-inch diameter bars spaced 1/2 inch apart.
A prison in the shape of a box can be up to 10 feet on a side, creating a solid barrier that prevents any matter from passing through it and blocking any spells cast into or out of the area.

When you cast the spell, any creature that is completely inside the cage's area is trapped. Creatures only partially within the area, or those too large to fit inside the area, are pushed away from the center of the area until they are completely outside the area.

A creature inside the cage can't leave it by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to leave the cage, it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature can use that magic to exit the cage. On a failure, the creature can't exit the cage and wastes the use of the spell or effect. The cage also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel. The cage has an AC of 5 and 240 hit points.
This spell can't be dispelled by dispel magic.

spell.name: Shapechange

m.text: a jade circlet worth at least 1,500 gp, which you must place on your head before you cast the spell

entries: For the duration you assume the form of a different creature. Pick 10 stat blocks with a challenge rating of 18 or lower when you prepare the spell. You can prepare the spell multiple times to pick more stat blocks. The creature can't be a construct or an undead, and you must have seen the sort of creature at least once. You transform into an average example of that creature, one without any class levels or the Spellcasting trait or any other trait that would allow for the casting spells.

Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen creature, though you retain your alignment and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature, if the creature has the same proficiency as you, and the bonus listed in its statistics is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus in place of yours. You can't use any legendary actions or lair actions of the new form.

You assume the hit points and Hit Dice of the new form. When you revert to your normal, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hitpoints, you aren't knocked {@condition unconscious}.

You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them, provided that your new form is physically capable of doing so. You can't use any special senses you have (for example, darkvision) unless your new form also has that sense. You can only speak if the creature can normally speak. You cannot use anything other than this spell to change shape.

When you transform, you choose whether your equipment falls to the ground, merges into the new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal. The DM determines whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change shape or size to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge into your new form. Equipment that merges has no effect in that state.

During this spell's duration, you can use your action to assume a different form following the same restrictions and rules for the original form, with one exception: if your new form has more hit points than your current one, your hit points remain at their current value.

spell.name: Prismatic Wall
entries: A shimmering, multicolored plane of light forms a vertical opaque wall – up to 90 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 inch thick – centered on a point you can see within range. Alternatively, you can shape the wall into a sphere up to 30 feet in diameter centered on a point you choose within range. The wall remains in place for the duration. If you position the wall so that it passes through a space occupied by a creature, the spell fails, and your action and the spell slot are wasted.

The wall sheds bright light out to a range of 100 feet and dim light for an additional 100 feet. You and creatures you designate at the time you cast the spell can pass through and remain near the wall without harm. If another creature that can see the wall moves to within 20 feet of it or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.

The wall consists of seven layers, each with a different color. When a creature attempts to reach into or pass through the wall, it does so one layer at a time through all the wall's layers. As it passes or reaches through each layer, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or be affected by that layer's properties as described below. After a creature makes a saving throw for a layer, they do not need to make a saving throw for that layer again until the start of their next turn.

The wall can be destroyed, also one layer at a time, in order from red to violet, by means specific to each layer. Once a layer is destroyed, it remains so for the duration of the spell. An Antimagic Field has no effect on it.
Red

The creature takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. While this layer is in place, nonmagical ranged attacks can't pass through the wall. The layer can be destroyed by dealing at least 25 cold damage to it.
Orange

The creature takes {@damage 10d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. While this layer is in place, magical ranged attacks can't pass through the wall. The layer is destroyed by a strong wind.
Yellow
The creature takes {@damage 10d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This layer can be destroyed by dealing at least 60 force damage to it.
Green

The creature takes {@damage 10d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Passwall spell, or another spell of equal or greater level that can open a portal on a solid surface, destroys this layer.
Blue
The creature takes {@damage 10d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This layer can be destroyed by dealing at least 25 fire damage to it.
Indigo

On a failed save, the creature is {@condition restrained}. It must then make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the spell ends. If it fails its save three times, it permanently turns to stone and is subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the creature collects three of a kind. While this layer is in place, spells can't be cast through the wall. The layer is destroyed by bright light shed by a Daylight spell or a similar spell of equal or higher level.
Violet

On a failed save, the creature is {@condition blinded}. It must then make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. A successful save ends the blindness. If it fails that save, the creature is transported to another plane of the DM's choosing and is no longer {@condition blinded}.
