(Typically, a creature that is on a plane that isn't its home plane is banished home, while other creatures are usually cast into the Astral or Ethereal planes.) This layer is destroyed by a Dispel Magic spell or similar spell of equal or higher level that can end spells and magical effects.

spell.name: Find Traps
entries: A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes anything that would inflict a sudden or unexpected effect you consider harmful or undesirable, which was specifically intended as such by its creator. Thus, the spell would sense an area affected by the alarm spell, a glyph of warding, or a mechanical pit trap, but it would not reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole.

spell.name: See Invisibility

components.m: a pinch of talc and a small sprinkling of powdered silver

entries: For the duration, a willing creature you can see within 30 ft can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible, and they can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, you can target one additional creature for each additional slot level.

spell.name: Mordenkainen's Sword

m.text: a miniature platinum sword with a grip and pommel of copper and zinc, worth 250 gp

entries: You create a sword-shaped plane of force that hovers within range. It lasts for the duration.

When the sword appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of the sword. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 7d10} force damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the sword up to 60 feet to a spot you can see and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.

spell.name: Word of Recall
entries: You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location, such as a temple, dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity. If you attempt to cast the spell in this manner in an area that isn't dedicated to your deity, the spell has no effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Rope Trick

components.m: powdered corn extract and a twisted loop of parchment

entries: You touch a length of rope that is up to 60 feet long. One end of the rope then rises into the air until the whole rope hangs perpendicular to the ground. At the upper end of the rope, an {@condition invisible} entrance opens to an extradimensional space that lasts until the spell ends.

The extradimensional space can be reached by climbing to the top of the rope. The space can hold as many as eight Medium or smaller creatures. As an action, a creature in the space can pull the rope into the space, making it disappear from view outside the space.
Attacks and spells can't cross through the entrance into or out of the extradimensional space, but those inside can see out of it as if through a 3-foot-by-5-foot window centered on the rope.
Anything inside the extradimensional space drops out when the spell ends.

spell.name: Bigby's Hand

components.m: an eggshell and a snakeskin glove

entries: You create a Large hand of shimmering, translucent force in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hand lasts for the spell's duration, and it moves at your command, mimicking the movements of your own hand.

The hand is an object that has AC 20 and hit points equal to your hit point maximum. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. It has a Strength of 26 (+8) and a Dexterity of 10 (+0). The hand doesn't fill its space.
When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on your subsequent turns, you can move the hand up to 60 feet and then cause one of the following effects with it.

entries.name: Clenched Fist
entries: The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand using your game statistics. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} force damage.

entries.name: Forceful Hand
entries: The hand attempts to push a creature within 5 feet of it in a direction you choose. Make a check with the hand's Strength contested by the Strength (Athletics) check of the target. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. If you succeed, the hand pushes the target up to 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to five times your spellcasting ability modifier. The hand moves with the target to remain within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Grasping Hand
entries: The hand attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. You use the hand's Strength score to resolve the grapple. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. While the hand is grappling the target, you can use a bonus action to have the hand crush it. When you do so, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries.name: Interposing Hand
entries: The hand interposes itself between you and a creature you choose until you give the hand a different command. The hand moves to stay between you and the target, providing you with half cover against the target. If the target attempts to move through the hand's space they make a strength saving throw. Once they make the saving throw they cannot make it again until the start of their next turn. On a failure, the target can't move through the hand's space until the start of their next turn. On a success that space is difficult terrain for the target until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage from the clenched fist option increases by {@dice 2d8} and the damage from the grasping hand increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Swift Quiver

components.m: a quiver containing at least one piece of ammunition

entries: You transmute your quiver so it produces an endless supply of non-magical ammunition, which seems to leap into your hand when you reach for it.

When you cast this spell and as a bonus action you can make two attacks with a weapon that uses ammunition from the quiver. Each time you make such a ranged attack, your quiver magically replaces the piece of ammunition you used with a similar piece of non-magical ammunition. Any pieces of ammunition created by this spell disintegrate when the spell ends. If the quiver leaves your possession, the spell ends.

spell.name: Simulacrum

m.text: snow or ice in quantities sufficient to make a life-size copy of the duplicated creature; some hair, fingernail clippings, or other piece of that creature's body placed inside the snow or ice; and powdered ruby worth 1,500 gp, sprinkled over the duplicate and consumed by the spell

entries: A beast or humanoid that is within range for the entire casting of the spell must make a wisdom saving throw. They may choose to fail. On a failure, you shape an illusory duplicate of them. The duplicate is a creature, partially real and formed from ice or snow, and it can take actions and otherwise be affected as a normal creature. It appears to be the same as the original, but it has half the creature's hit point maximum, is a construct, is formed without any equipment, can't cast spells, can't change shape, can't take long rests, can't take short rests, is immune to {@condition exhaustion} and can't recover hit points. Otherwise, the illusion uses all the statistics of the creature it duplicates.

The simulacrum is friendly to you and creatures you designate. It obeys your spoken commands, moving and acting in accordance with your wishes and acting on your turn in combat. The simulacrum lacks the ability to learn or become more powerful, so it never increases its level or other abilities, nor can it regain expended spell slots.

If the simulacrum is damaged, you can repair it in an alchemical laboratory over the course of an hour, using rare herbs and minerals worth 100 gp per hit point it regains. The simulacrum lasts until it drops to 0 hit points, at which point it reverts to snow and melts instantly.
If you cast this spell again, any currently active duplicates you created with this spell are instantly destroyed.

spell.name: Magic Jar

m.text: a gem, crystal, reliquary, or some other ornamental container worth at least 500 gp

entries: Your body falls into a catatonic state as your soul leaves it and enters the container you used for the spell's material component. Any soul that inhabits the container is aware of their surroundings as if they were in the container's space. They cannot move or take actions. You in particular can use your action to end the spell or attempt to possess a humanoid's body.

You can attempt to possess any humanoid within 100 feet of you that you can see (creatures warded by a protection from evil and good or magic circle spell can't be possessed). The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, your soul moves into the target's body, and the target's soul becomes trapped in the container. On a success, the target resists your efforts to possess it, and you can't attempt to possess it again using a spell of this level or lower for 24 hours.

Once you possess a creature's body, you control it. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the creature, though you retain your alignment and your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You retain the benefit of your own class features. You can't use any of the target's class features. You can't use the spellcasting or change shape features of the possessed creature.
This spell ends and every soul returns to their original body if the following occurs:
- The container is destroyed
- The host body dies
- The host body gets possessed by another creature
- The host body ceases to be a humanoid
- You use your action to end the spell
- The spell ends for some other reason
When the spell ends, the container is destroyed. If a soul returns to a dead body, they die.

spell.name: Enthrall
entries: You weave a distracting string of words. Creatures of your choice that you can see within range and that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature that can't be {@condition charmed} succeeds on this saving throw automatically, and if you or your companions are fighting a creature, it has advantage on the save. On a failed save, the target does not notice you casting this spell and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive any creature other than you until the spell ends or until the target can no longer hear you. The spell ends if you are {@condition incapacitated} or can no longer speak.

spell.name: Compelled Duel
entries: You attempt to compel a creature into a duel. One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is drawn to you, compelled by your divine demand. For the duration, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you, and can't move away from you.
The spell ends if a creature friendly to you damages the target or casts a harmful spell on it, or if you end your turn more than 30 feet away from the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level you can target one additional creature for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Geas
entries: You place a magical command on a creature that you can see within range, forcing it to carry out some service or refrain from some action or course of activity as you decide.

If the creature can understand you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. While the creature is {@condition charmed} by you, it takes {@damage 5d10} psychic damage each time it acts in a manner directly counter to your instructions, but no more than once per minute. A creature that can't understand you is unaffected by the spell. If you concentrate on the spell for the full duration, the effect lasts for 30 days.

You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. A Remove Curse, Greater Restoration, or Wish spell also ends it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level and concentrate on it for the full duration, the effect lasts for 1 year. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level and concentrate on it for the full duration, the effect lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

spell.name: Tenser's Transformation

components.m: a few hairs from a bull

entries: You endow yourself with endurance and martial prowess fueled by magic. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain 50 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.
You have advantage on attack rolls that you make with simple and martial weapons.
When you hit a target with a weapon attack, that target takes an extra {@damage 2d12} force damage.
You have proficiency with all armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.
You have proficiency in Strength and Constitution saving throws.
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.
You can drop or stow anything your holding
You can draw up to two weapons
You can instantly don armor that you have on your person

entries: Immediately after the spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Blade of Disaster
entries: You create a blade-shaped planar rift about 3 feet long in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The blade lasts for the duration. When you cast this spell, you can make up to two melee spell attacks with the blade, each one against a creature, loose object, or structure within 5 feet of the blade. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d12} force damage. This attack scores a critical hit if the number on the {@dice d20} is 18 or higher. On a critical hit, the blade deals an extra {@damage 8d12} force damage (for a total of {@damage 16d12} force damage).
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the blade up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see and then make up to two melee spell attacks with it again.
The blade can harmlessly pass through any barrier, including a Wall of Force.

spell.name: Color Spray

components.m: a pinch of powder or sand that is colored red, yellow, and blue

entries: A dazzling array of flashing, colored light springs from your hand. Creatures in a 10-foot cone must make a wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn. Creatures that are {@condition unconscious} or cannot see are not affected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, increase the size of the cone by 5 ft for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Enhance Ability

components.m: fur or a feather from a beast

entries: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose an ability score. For the duration of this spell they add a {@dice d8} to ability checks they make that use that ability score. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, the creature can choose to reroll the {@dice d8} once within the duration of the spell for each additional level. They must use the new roll.

spell.name: Onyx Door

time.condition: which you take when a large or smaller creature you can see within 10 ft falls prone

entries: A door made of onyx manifests under the creature and opens for them to fall through. They must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (they can choose to fail), or they are teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. They cannot be teleported further than half their movement speed (ignoring any effects that are setting their movement speed to 0). You can cast this spell at the moment you fall {@condition prone} from going {@condition unconscious}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's range increases by 10 ft when you reach levels 5 (20 feet), 11 (30 feet), and 17 (40 feet).

spell.name: Silent Knight
entries: Touch a willing creature to create a 5 ft radius of silence centered on them until the end of your next turn.. While creatures are in the affected area they cannot create sound, cast a spell that includes a verbal component or deal thunder damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration is extended by one round when you reach levels 5 (2 rounds), 11 (3 rounds) and 17 (4 rounds)

spell.name: Acid Mitt
entries: Acid engulfs your hand allowing it to melt through armor and damage the creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Acid damage, and has -1 AC until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Static Fuzz
entries: You release motes of static that float around a creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage, and until the end of your next turn they emit 5ft of bright light and an additional 5ft of dim light. Creatures in the bright light perceive dim light as darkness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Metabolize
entries: The target can expend one of its Hit Dice, and you then roll that die. They regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll. Once you cast this on a creature, you cannot cast it on that creature again until you take a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: An additional hit die is expended and rolled when you reach levels 5 (2 hit dice), 11 (3 hit dice), and 17 (4 hit dice).

spell.name: Starry Wisp
entries: You launch a mote of light at one creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage, and until the end of your next turn, it emits Dim Light in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Sorcerous Burst
entries: You cast sorcerous energy at one creature or object within range. Make a ranged attack roll against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} damage. If you roll an 8 on a {@dice d8} for this spell, you can roll another {@dice d8}, and add it to the damage. You choose the damage type each time you cast this spell: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Psychic, or Thunder.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach level 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Elementalism
entries: You exert control over the elements, creating one of the following effects within range:

Beckon Air. You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and close open doors and shutters, all in a 5-foot cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren't affected.
Beckon Earth. You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5-foot-square area, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand.

Beckon Fire. You create a thin cloud of harmless embers and colored, scented smoke in a 5-foot cube. You choose the color and scent, and the embers can light candles, torches, or lamps in that area. The smoke's scent lingers for 1 minute.

Beckon Water. You create a spray of cool mist that lightly dampens creatures and objects in a 5-foot cube. Alternatively, you create 1 cup of clean water either in an open container or on a surface, and the water evaporates in 1 minute.
Sculpt Element. You cause dirt, sand, fire, smoke, mist, or water that can fit in a 1-foot cube to assume a crude shape (such as that of a creature or an object) for 1 hour.

spell.name: Executioner

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch gets damaged by a creature within 10 ft

entries: A willing creature of your choice within 10 ft moves up to their movement speed straight towards the damager and can spend their reaction to make a melee attack against them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, the distance the damager and the creature you choose can be within increases by 10 ft for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Uptick

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 90 ft would fail an attack roll, ability check or saving throw

entries: You tick back time a single second, allowing the target to roll another {@dice d20}. Compare the number on the die of both rolls to 18. If the new number's distance from 18 is greater than the old number's distance from 18, it replaces it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, subtract 1 from the number your comparing to for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Downtick

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 90 ft would succeed on an attack roll, ability check or saving throw

entries: You tick back time a single second, forcing the target to make a wisdom saving throw. If they fail, they roll another {@dice d20}. Compare the number on the die of both rolls to 3. If the new number's distance from 3 is greater than the old number's distance from 3, it replaces it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, add 1 to the number your comparing to for each additional slot level.

spell.name: Reclaimed Shrapnel

time.condition: which you take before or after a creature you can touch would fail a saving throw

entries: You push a piece of shrapnel into each wound where they melt into golden light. Heal the target {@dice 2d2} + your spellcasting modifier.

components.m: a handful of shrapnel

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, add {@dice 2d2} for each additional level.

spell.name: Shining Smite
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon. As you hit the creature, your strike flares with divine light. The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage from the attack. If the target has the Invisible condition, that condition ends on it. In addition, until the spell ends, the target sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius, attack rolls against it have Advantage, and it can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Divine Smite
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action immediately after hitting a target with a melee weapon. As you hit the target, your strike glows with divine power. The target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage from the attack. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} if the target is a Fiend or an Undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Arcane Eruption
entries: Churning magical energy explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. When you cast the spell, you select the type of damage dealt by the explosion: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Psychic, or Thunder. Each creature in the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} damage of the chosen type. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

Choose one of those d6s. The number rolled on that die determines a condition that's applied to each creature that failed the save, as shown below. A creature has the condition until the end of your next turn.
{@dice  d6} table:
1 Incapacitated
2 Blinded
3 Frightened
4 Poisoned
5 Charmed
6 Deafened

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 5 or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4.

spell.name: Prototype
entries: Make a crafting check to make an object. This spell lasts for the duration of the check. Failing the crafting check does not negatively affect the materials. If the object you craft can be attuned to, the first attempt to attune to it is instantaneous. The object has no uses of any magical limited-use features that do not regain uses at dawn, after a long rest or after a short rest. When the spell ends, the object turns back into the materials it was crafted out of.

spell.name: Contract
entries: You touch a contract to enchant it. One creature can sign it. If you or a creature that willingly signed the contract violates the terms of the contract then the contract ends, both creatures know the contract has ended and the violator takes {@damage 3d8} radiant, psychic or necrotic damage. Choose the damage type when you prepare the spell. The DM might allow you to replace the damage with an equivalent consequence defined in the contract. This consequence might punish the violator or aid an entity in punishing the violator. Whatever the consequence is, it has no effect whenever it would be used for anything other than punishing the violator.

If the contract is destroyed, the spell ends. The contract has AC equal to 5 + your spellcasting ability and hit points equal to 5 times the level your casting this spell at. A remove curse, greater restoration, or wish spell also ends it if it is casted at a level equal to or greater than the level this spell was casted at.

m.text: A contract made of 10gp worth of paper and ink

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, increase the damage by {@dice 2d8} for each additional slot level. Additionally, increase the duration if the spell is casted at level 3 (1 day), level 4 (1 week), level 5 (1 month), level 6 (1 year), level 7 (1 decade), level 8 (1 century), level 9 (1 millennium).

spell.name: Power Word Fortify
entries: You speak a word of power that fortifies up to six creatures you can see within range. The spell bestows 120 Temporary Hit Points, which are divided equally among the spell's recipients.

spell.name: Fount of Moonlight
entries: A cool light wreaths your body for the duration, emitting Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. This counts as moonlight. Until the spell ends, you have Resistance to Radiant damage, and your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage on a hit. In addition, immediately after you take damage from a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself, you can use your Reaction to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the Blinded condition until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Glide
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a glide speed of 30 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

spell.name: Burrow
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a burrow speed of 60 feet for the duration.

spell.name: Pearly Gate

time.condition: which you take when a large or smaller creature you can see within 10 ft gets up from prone

entries: A lustrous white gate manifests above the creature for them to rise through. They must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (they can choose to fail), or they pass through the gate and are teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. They cannot be teleported further than the movement they spent getting up from {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's range increases by 10 ft when you reach levels 5 (15 feet), 11 (20 feet), and 17 (25 feet).

spell.name: Cloud Jump

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature you can see within 30ft moves

entries: You create a cloud for the target to momentarily step on. If the target is currently jumping, they can change the direction of their jump. Regardless, the target can move 5 ft in a straight line without spending movement.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, increase the distance they move by 5 ft for every additional level.

spell.name: Haunt
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 30 ft. While you are within 15 ft of the target you cannot be seen or heard except by the target and undead creatures. You show up in reflections, photography, and other things that instantly capture your likeness. If someone can see you or your likeness is captured while you are within the affected area, you appear ghostly and translucent. This spell ends if you harm a creature while you're within the affected area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, target an additional creature for each additional spell level. All of the targets can see and hear you regardless of which radius you're in.

spell.name: Minor Wish
entries: Choose a spell list you have access to when you prepare this spell. You can prepare Minor Wish multiple times to choose multiple spell lists. You cast a spell of 0-th level of your choice from that spell list. Additionally, You do not expend the casting time or components (except for costly components) to cast it. The casting time of this spell becomes the casting time of the spell you chose. Once you cast Minor Wish in this way, you can't cast it again until you finish a short rest.

Alternatively, you can speak aloud a wish (no more than 10 words). The DM will choose a casting time and grant an effect based on the wish. If the effect is vague or more powerful than a 0th-level spell, the DM will balance out the wish by reducing its effect, adding unintended consequences, or a combination of both. Once you cast Minor Wish in this way, you can't cast it again until you finish a long rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, the level of the spell you cast increases by up to one for every slot level above 2nd (you choose how much). The spell that is casted does not expend a spell slot.

spell.name: Ghostwalk
entries: You are {@condition invisible} until you've moved 5ft, the turn ends, or you harm a creature. Undead creatures can still see you. Additionally, you show up in reflections, photography, and other similar things. If something can see you while you're {@condition invisible}, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The distance you can move increases by 5ft when you reach levels 5 (10 ft), 11 (15 ft), and 17 (20 ft).

spell.name: Snapback
entries: As a bonus action before the end of your next turn you can teleport back to the location where you casted this spell. You can use this once and regain all uses after a short rest. You fail to teleport if the location is occupied or in another plane of existence.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of times you can use this spell before resting increases by 1 when you reach Rogue levels 5 (2 uses), 11 (3 uses), and 17 (4 uses).

spell.name: Wreathe

time.condition: which you take before a willing creature you can see within 60 ft hits or misses with an attack roll.

entries: If the attack deals damage, change up to 5 of the damage to a damage type of your choice. On a hit, deal 1 extra damage of the damage type you chose.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, increase the extra damage by 1 and increase the amount of damage that is converted to a different damage type by 5 for each additional spell level.

My balancing concerns with the spell are not whether I should buff or nerf it, but whether it should exist in the first place. Pure damage output from a reaction with a trigger that will almost certainly trigger does not seem like something that should be in the game. That said, the spell feels cool to cast. Overall I'm experimenting with having reduced effects for reaction spells that have more certain triggers.

spell.name: Maze
entries: You force a creature to succeed on an intelligence saving throw or be banish into an everchanging labyrinthine demiplane.

For every 30 ft it moves while in the maze it can make an intelligence saving throw (the direction of the movement does not matter). If it succeeds three times in a row, it escapes (a {@creature minotaur} or {@creature goristro} demon automatically succeeds).
When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Animate Objects
entries: Objects come to life at your command. Choose up to ten nonmagical objects within range that are not being worn or carried. Medium targets count as two objects, Large targets count as four objects, Huge targets count as eight objects. You can't animate any object larger than Huge. Each target animates and becomes a creature under your control until the spell ends or until reduced to 0 hit points.

As a bonus action, you can mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

An animated object is a construct with AC, hit points, attacks, Strength, and Dexterity determined by its size. At minimum the damage roll for its attack deals 1 damage. Its Constitution is 10 and its Intelligence and Wisdom are 3, and its Charisma is 1. Its speed is 30 feet; if the object lacks legs or other appendages it can use for locomotion, it instead has a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. If the object is securely attached to a surface or a larger object, such as a chain bolted to a wall, its speed is 0. It has blindsight with a radius of 30 feet and is blind beyond that distance. When the animated object drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original object form, and any remaining damage carries over to its original object form.

If you command an object to attack, it can make a single melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. It makes a slam attack with an attack bonus and bludgeoning damage determined by its size. The DM might rule that a specific object inflicts slashing or piercing damage based on its form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can animate two additional objects for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Silvery Barbs

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself succeeds on an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw

entries: This spell has been replaced by the Downtick and Uptick spells. If a feature would teach you this spell, learn Downtick or Uptick instead.

spell.name: Lesser Restoration
entries: You touch a creature and can end one condition afflicting it. The condition can be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}.

spell.name: Greater Restoration

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to end one of the following effects on the target:

items: One effect that {@condition charmed} or {@condition petrified} the target
One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item
Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

entries: Alternatively, you can allow the target to expend a vitality to remove an {@condition exhaustion} or expend a boon to remove a wound that the DM deems is of equivalent or worse value.

spell.name: Purify Food and Drink
entries: All nonmagical food and drink within a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range is purified and rendered free of poison, disease, acids and mold.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the radius by 10 ft for each additional level.

spell.name: Detect Chemicals

components.m: a yew leaf

entries: For the duration, you can sense the presence and location of poisons, acids, poisonous creatures and acidic creatures within 30 feet of you. You identify the kind of poison or acid if it costs 20 gp or less. You identify the kind of poisonous or acidic creature if its CR rating is 3 or less or its level is 2 or less.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, the cost of poisons and acids you can detect triples, the level of creatures you can detect increases by 2, and the CR rating of creatures you can detect increases by 3 for every additional level.

spell.name: Detect Poison and Disease

components.m: a yew leaf

entries: Replaced by Detect Chemicals. If you would learn this spell, learn the spell that has replaced it instead.

spell.name: Detect Evil and Good
entries: For the duration, you know if there is an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead within 30 feet of you. If its CR is 3 or less or its level is 2 or less you know where its located and invisibility cannot prevent you from seeing it. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, increase the CR by 3 and the player level by 2 for each additional level.

spell.name: Bless

components.m: a sprinkling of holy water

entries: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Skill Empowerment
entries: Your magic deepens a creature's understanding of its own talent. You touch one willing creature and choose a skill; until the spell ends, add 4 to ability checks it makes using that skill. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.
You must choose a skill in which the target is proficient, but does not have expertise in.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the bonus to ability checks using that skill by 1 for every 2 additional levels.

spell.name: Channel Craftsman

components.m: the insignia of a dead craftsman

entries: Choose a tool mastery. You can use two tool masteries when you make a tool check instead of one. It can be the same mastery twice. One of the tool masteries must be one of the tool masteries you chose. Undead creatures, creatures that can see through invisibility, and instant capturing of your likeness (such as reflections) perceive a spirit guiding your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the number of masteries you choose by 1 for each additional level.

spell.name: Beast Bond

components.m: a bit of fur wrapped in a cloth

entries: You establish a telepathic link with one beast you touch that is willing or {@condition charmed} by you. Until the spell ends, the link is active while you and the beast are within line of sight of each other. Through the link, the beast can understand your telepathic messages to it, and it can telepathically communicate simple emotions and concepts back to you. While the link is active, the beast adds a {@dice d4} to its attack rolls against creatures within your reach.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, change the {@dice d4} to a {@dice d6}. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, change the {@dice d4} to a {@dice d8}.

spell.name: Beast Sense
entries: You touch a beast that is willing or {@condition charmed} by you. For the duration of the spell, you can use your action to see through the beast's eyes and hear what it hears, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses. While perceiving through the beast's senses, you gain the benefits of any special senses possessed by that creature, though you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own surroundings.

spell.name: Branding Smite
entries: Replaced by shining smite. If you gain this spell, gain shining smite instead.

spell.name: Thorn Whip

components.m: the stem of a plant with thorns

entries: You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Booming Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly moves 5 feet or more before then, the target takes {@damage 1d8} thunder damage, and the spell ends.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you reach 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage to the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for moving increases to {@damage 2d8}. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 3d8}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Green-Flame Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause green fire to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes fire damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the target on a hit, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to {@damage 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

spell.name: Message

components.m: a short piece of copper wire

entries: You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn't have to follow a straight line and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Mending

components.m: two lodestones

entries: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.
This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Minor Illusion

components.m: a bit of fleece

entries: You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Prestidigitation
entries: This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

items: You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.
You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Spiny Shield

time.condition: which you take when an attack deals damage to a creature you can touch

components.m: a small quill

entries: An barrier of spikes interposes itself between the target and the attacker. Reduce the damage by {@dice 1d6}. If it was a melee attack, deal piercing damage to the attacker equal to the amount reduced.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the amount reduced by {@dice 1d6} for each additional level.

spell.name: Relay

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature makes a ranged attack against you

entries: You redirect the projectile of a willing attacker. Change the target of the attack to a creature you can see within a number of feet equal to the attack's remaining range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, add 10 to the distance you can choose a new target within for each additional level.

components.m: a baton

spell.name: Reflect

time.condition: which you take before a creature you can touch is targeted by a spell or is affected by a spell's line area of effect

components.m: a hand mirror

entries: The caster makes a constitution saving throw. They can choose to fail. Add half the level your casting this spell at rounded up and subtract the level of the spell you're reflecting from your Spell Save DC. On a failure, you reflect the spell. If the spell targeted you, change the target to a creature you can see within the spell's range. If the spell is a line area of effect, change its direction starting at a point on the line you can touch.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description)

spell.name: Mage Hand
entries: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you can see within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. If you do, you can move it up to 30 ft and have it perform one object interaction. The hand can hold one object that is 10 pounds or less, cannot exert more than 10 pounds of force, cannot deal damage and has no sense of touch.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Dancing Lights

components.m: a bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

entries: You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vague medium sized silhouette of yourself. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Find Greater Steed
entries: Removed. If you are granted this spell, learn Find Steed instead.
